info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 01 at 12:16AM CDT until June 01 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL FLOYD...MOTLEY AND SOUTHEASTERN HALE COUNTIES... At 1215 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles north of Matador to 6 miles southeast of Hale Center, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Floydada, Matador, Lockney, Dougherty, Aiken and Roaring Springs. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
